intro: Chamaesium shrestaeanum, commonly known as the Nepal golden bell, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and India. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, adding a striking visual element to its natural habitat. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in local medicine.
